tasks.title: [LOW] Tree2mydoor - Consider Renaming "Shirazz" Tree (optional)
tasks.notes:
**Priority**: LOW (Optional)
**Products Affected**: 1 tree variety

**Issue**: Tree named "Shirazz" flagged as alcohol (false positive)

**Action Options**:
1. Rename to "Ornamental Tree - Shirazz Variety" to avoid trigger
2. OR leave as-is (acceptable loss - 1 product out of thousands)

**Recommendation**: Monitor only, no immediate action required

**Expected Impact**: NEGLIGIBLE

**Reference**: See /tools/product-impact-analyzer/DISAPPROVAL-ACTION-PLAN.md

tasks.title: [Tree2MyDoor] Investigate Search Campaign Performance Collapse
tasks.notes:
**From Weekly Report - 2025-11-20**

**Issue:** Three search campaigns collapsed to 0% ROAS with zero conversions

**Campaigns Affected:**
- T2MD | Search | Anniversary - Exact: ROAS 215% → 0% (-215pp WoW)
- T2MD | Search | Olive Tree Gifts: ROAS 3,279% → 0% (-3,279pp WoW)
- T2MD | Search | Roses - Broad: ROAS 313% → 82% (-231pp WoW)

**Expected Impact:** £20/week wasted spend + lost opportunity on previously high-performing campaigns

**Action Items:**
1. Check Google Merchant Centre feed status for Anniversary roses and Olive Tree products
2. Verify product availability on website
3. Review search term reports for query quality degradation
4. Confirm conversion tracking is firing correctly on these product pages

**Supporting Data:**
- Weekly report: clients/tree2mydoor/reports/weekly/2025-11-20-weekly-report.md
- Total conversions dropped from 40.1 to 26.3 (-34.4% WoW)
- Account ROAS declined from 122% to 90% (-32pp)

tasks.title: [Tree2MyDoor] Decide which brand campaign to keep
tasks.notes:
**Strategic Decision Required**

**Context:** Nils Rooijmans email (Nov 19/20, 2025) outlined best practice for brand Shopping campaigns.

Evaluate current brand campaigns and decide which to keep for optimal performance.

**Action Items:**
1. Review performance of all brand campaigns (clicks, conversions, ROAS, CPC)
2. Analyze overlap and cannibalization between campaigns
3. Check search term reports for query coverage
4. Determine optimal brand campaign structure
5. Apply Nils Rooijmans' LOW-priority methodology if using Shopping campaigns
6. Document recommendation with supporting data

**Evaluation Criteria:**
- ROAS performance
- Impression share coverage
- CPC efficiency
- Query match quality
- Conversion rate
- Campaign priority settings (if Shopping)

**Nils Rooijmans' Best Practice (if Shopping brand campaign):**
- LOW-priority Shopping campaign for brand searches
- HIGH manual CPC bids for maximum visibility
- Brand terms in negative keyword list on non-brand campaigns
- All products in brand campaign ALSO in non-brand campaigns

**Supporting Data Needed:**
- Last 30 days performance by campaign
- Search term reports
- Auction insights (if available)
- Budget allocation efficiency
- Campaign priority settings
